summary: A personal lighting mod focused more on aesthetic value while still trying to keep a subtle dark and light contrast.
descriptionHtml:
Aesthetic Lighting ENB102 V03
=========================================================
This mod could NOT be possible without the work of these two:
Kudos to Boris Voronstov and HeliosDoubleSix\'s bloom code.

Helios\' Work:

HeliosDoubleSix - ENB HD6 Lighting Enhancement - Dark Nights
http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=4142

Boris\'s Original ENB:

Boris Vorontsov - Original Ultimate graphic enhancement
http://enbdev.com/

Check their stuff out and endorse em. they are the stuff of awesome. =)
=======================================================
Changes overview:

-tweaked some blown out parts in some areas, (like in markarth//solitude)
-started tweaking *some* subsurface stuff
-Eye adaptation is easier on the eyes//more gentle as to not be too intrusive.
-Added some specularity during nights, 
-added a more subtle contrast//saturation during daylight
-Focused a lot on tweaking and balancing places such as High Hrothgar and Winterhold
 (2 major problem areas where distances had wrong contrast with water//land relationship)
-tweaked how heavy snowfall looks with distances in general
-evened out star lights
-tweaked sky clouds to match far volumetric clouds (for the most part)
-tweaked the \"radioactive\" night sky issue to be more evened out, and a lot more natural looking

-overall, tried to tie in more and more the color and lighting so that it holds together in different conditions =)

you can check the numbers in the enbseries.ini to see which values i used (prior to the one set currently.
Theyre in the parentheses respectively in chronological order.

Again, sorry for the delay guys. 

please let me know any feedback or anything you find in the mod.


**********************Installation***********************
-extract everything in the main Skyrim directory, where the EXE file is
-for no ambient occlusion, simply replace the enbseries.ini with the one in the folder (called NO AMBIENT OCCLUSION). or just simply edit the .ini file by just changing:


EnableAmbientOcclusion=true
to
EnableAmbientOcclusion=false


****I highly suggest not to use//turn off antialiasing with it on, for obvious reasons of decreased fps, or just use FXAA =)**** 

--------
--------

NOTES:
for a more \"realistic\" lighting, (i.e. darker nights and whatnot) I HIGHLY suggest using:

Realistic Lighting Without Post-Processing by 747823
http://skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=4323

with this tweak.
author: Xadrach
